intro: Erycibe fragrans, commonly known as the fragrant erycibe, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant produces large, fleshy fruits that are edible and often used in local cuisines. Its leaves are broad and palmate, contributing to its ornamental value in gardens. Erycibe fragrans is also valued for its aromatic properties and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
